content: Sesame seeds in grocery store jars are generally pretty expensive. For example, checking instacart for Whole Foods prices near you, a 2.08 oz jar is $3.69, but the bulk is $5.99 a pound. That’s fully 5 times as expensive. I’d be interested in what the exact same thing would have cost at Whole Foods — I bet that the cheese, eggs, chicken and strawberries would be *much* (like, 25%+) more, but the rest a little less, especially bc you would have saved $6.60 just on the sesame seeds and the oats (switching to Bob’s at $4.39). You can cart it all up at Instacart without registering — Whole Foods doesn’t (yet) upcharge for their orders (I’ve seen what the store employees have to do — I would totally upcharge, even if it’s just a flat $2/order).
